intro: Schizoloma coursii, commonly known as the African horned vulture, is a unique plant species native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, and often branched structure, which resembles the skeletal appearance of a vulture. The plant is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing abilities through symbiotic relationships with bacteria. Its leaves are typically small and clustered, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Schizoloma coursii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
